Column Comment.0: OBLIGATION: a condition of commitment on the agreement which must be fulfilled.There are many types of obligations and the fulfillment of an obligation may require achange to the agreement. e.g. offset obligation, work commitment, section 96 etc.Obligations may be financial (rental payments) or non financial (drilling, reportingetc.)
Column Comment.1: OBLIGATION SEQ NO: Unique identifier for each part or occurrence of an obligation
Column Comment.2: PAYEE PAYOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE: The identifier for the business associatewho is the payee or payor for the obligation.
Column Comment.3: PAYEE_PAYOR: Whether the Business Associate is a payee of the obligation or apayor of the obligation.
Column Comment.4: DETAIL ID: Used where each payment (or receipt) may be broken down into splits orother components)
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: CHEQUE NUMBER: Cheque number of obligation payment
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.8: CURRENCY ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: the currency in which the funds wereinitially received. When the Stored currency is multiplied by the CURRENCYCONVERSION, the value of the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.9: DEDUCTION IND: An indicator that this portion of payment detail is a deduction fromanother payment detail, such as a tax deduction
Column Comment.10: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.11: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.12: PAYMENT AMOUNT: Amount of each payment portion
Column Comment.13: PAYMENT DATE: Date payment is to be made
Column Comment.14: R PAYMENT DETAIL TYPE: may be tax, bank service charge, lessor payment
Column Comment.15: PERCENT OF PAYMENT: The percent of the total payment due the payee, whenthere are more than one payees to share an obligation payment.
Column Comment.16: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.17: RATE: Rate charged by a jurisdiction per hectare/acre
Column Comment.18: RATE ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE: The original units used, : usually currencyper size, such as Cdn dollars per hectare.
Column Comment.19: REMARK: narrative remarks about the obligation payment detail.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
